headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: Trump Repeats Election Lies, Dodges on Ukraine and Abortion Ban; GOP and Undeclared Voters in New Hampshire Weigh in on Trump's Responses. Aired 7-7:30a ET

utterances.speaker: POPPY HARLOW, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: The 89-year-old senator returned to the Capitol yesterday after a months' long recovery from shingles. In a statement, she said she's still experiencing some of the side effects. She'll be working a lighter schedule.

utterances.speaker: PHIL MATTINGLY, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Yes. But her return gives Democrats back their full majority. Some lawmakers from her own party have been calling on her to retire or resign, because without her vote, the Senate Judiciary Committee could not push through some of President Biden's key nominees.Now, in her statement yesterday, Senator Feinstein said she, quote, looks forward to resuming her work from the committee.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: CNN this morning continues right now.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: JAKE TAPPER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Mr. Trump's falsehoods kept coming fast and furious.

utterances.speaker: KAITLAN COLLINS, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Will you commit tonight to accepting the results of the 2024 election?DONALD TRUMP, FORMER U.S. PRESIDENT:  Yes, if I think it's an honest election.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Did you ever show the classified documents to anyone?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Not really. I would have the right to.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: There's a jury of nine people found you libel of sexual abuse. Do you think that that will deter women from voting for you?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I would be salivating if I were the attorneys for E. Jean Carroll, if I were Jack Smith.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Kevin McCarthy says he will not support George Santos' re-election. UNIDENTIFIED FEMALEREP. GEORGE SANTOS (R-NY):  The reality is it's a witch hunt.

utterances.speaker: MANU RAJU, CNN CHIEF CONGRESSIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: If the Ethics Committee finds that Santos broke the law, would you call on him to resign? McCarthy said, quote, yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The Biden administration is hours away from the end of Title 42.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: They'll enter undetected if they have to just to get into the United States.

utterances.speaker: ALEJANDRO MAYORKAS, HOMELAND SECURITY SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: We are making it very clear that our border is not open, that crossing irregularly is against the law.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The prime suspect in the disappearance of Americans (INAUDIBLE) Natalee Holloway in Aruba is heading to the U.S. to face charges.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Van der Sloot has been serving 28 years in a Peruvian prison for murdering the young student he met in a casino in 2010.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Curry spots up in the corner, got it. We are headed for a game six.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The drive off the window, slam down with the hammer.The Knicks get it done at home.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It's the playoffs. You've got to do whatever you can to win, which you watch as a kid.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Good morning, everyone. I'm glad I've been such a loyal diehard Knicks fan.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: That was an amazing turnabout in the last 3.5 minutes, and impressive.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Right?

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: And like the self-confidence and just not even -- wow.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I had asked Phil if they won this morning.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Just kind of reminiscent to tell the (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: What a fair weather fan I am.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: You're not fair weather. It's like if you're a Knicks, maybe you don't want to be all the way in at all times.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: The only thing I care about is everything that comes from Minnesota, so the Timberwolves, the Twins, the Vikings.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: How are they all doing? They're doing great?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes, great. Good morning.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: To the news, Donald Trump facing critical questions from our own Kaitlan Collins as he runs for president again despite multiple criminal investigations and felony charges. Now, right off the bat, Trump refused to admit he lost the 2020 election, he did. He bad mouthed E. Jean Carroll just one day after a jury found he sexually abused and defamed her. Trump vowed to pardon January 6th rioters who attacked the Capitol. He took credit for overturning Roe versus Wade but then repeatedly, five times, declined to say if he would sign a federal abortion ban. And Trump wouldn't call Russian President Vladimir Putin a war criminal or say whether he wanted Ukraine to even win the war at all.CNN's Chief National Affairs Correspondent Jeff Zeleny is here breaking down the highlights. Jeff, you've made this point repeatedly, he's not changing, he is who he is. What was your view of things last night?

utterances.speaker: JEFF ZELENY, CNN CHIEF NATIONAL AFFAIRS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Hey, good morning, Phil and Poppy. I mean, perhaps coming as no surprise to anyone who has been watching him, for Donald Trump, the second act is the same as the first, airing old grievances and attempting to rewrite history. The former president was acting as though he had already won the Republican nomination, spending almost no time on his GOP rivals or trying to broaden his appeal to voters. But he was aggressively pressed for the first time on a long trail of controversies that define the 2024 campaign.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) ZELENY (voice over):  Former Donald Trump picked up where he left off, lying about the 2020 election.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: That was a rigged election and it's a shame that we had to go through it.

utterances.speaker: ZELENY
utterances.sentences: Trump made clear the 2024 presidential bid would follow the same script of his two previous campaigns, presenting himself as a defiant messenger unburdened by facts and unwilling to move on.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Will you suspend polarizing talk of election fraud during your run for president?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Yes, unless I see election fraud. If I see election fraud, I think I have an obligation to say it.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No, because he did something wrong. He should have put the votes back to the state legislatures, and I think we would have had different outcome.

utterances.speaker: WAYNE BEYER, NEW HAMPSHIRE VOTER
utterances.sentences: My question to you is would you pardon the January 6 rioters who were convicted of federal offenses?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I am inclined to pardon many of them, I can say for every single one, because a couple of them probably they got out of control.

utterances.speaker: ZELENY
utterances.sentences: The audience of Republican voters at Saint Anselm College applauded for much of the night, even as Trump he belittled and demeaned former magazine columnist E. Jean Carroll, a day of after a New York jury found him liable of sexually abusing and defaming her.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I have no idea who the hell -- she's a whack job.

utterances.speaker: ZELENY
utterances.sentences: Pressed by Kaitlan Collins about whether the verdict would deter women from voting for him, he said this.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: ZELENY
utterances.sentences: Yet some Republicans believe otherwise, like New Hampshire Governor Chris Sununu, who is considering a presidential bid of his own.GOV. CHRIS SUNUNU (R-NH):  If you're a suburban mom, all these voters that Republicans are trying to bring back into the mix, I don't see any of them being convinced by anything because it's just kind of a same old regurgitation.

utterances.speaker: ZELENY
utterances.sentences: Seven months before voting begins in the Republican presidential primary, Trump is leading the field, even as he faces multiple legal challenges over interfering in the 2020 election and more.Once again, he struck a defensive tone about that now infamous call to the Georgia secretary of state, searching for votes to put him over the top against Joe Biden, who narrowly won the state.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: That election was rigged. And if this goes bad, why did him and his lawyers hang up? How dare you say that? This was a --

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: They clearly were concerned enough, they recorded the call.

utterances.speaker: ZELENY
utterances.sentences: He brushed aside questions of another probe involving classified documents taken to Mar-a-Lago.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: When it comes to your documents, did you ever show those classified documents to anyone?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Not really. I would have the right to. By the way, they were declassified -- COLLINS

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Not that I can think of. Let me just tell you, I have the absolute right to do whatever I want with them. I have the right.

utterances.speaker: ZELENY
utterances.sentences: That, of course, remains an open question and a key part of a federal investigation.Trump took personal credit for the Supreme Court decision overturning Roe versus Wade, citing his three appointments to the high court.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: And I was very honored to do it.

utterances.speaker: ZELENY
utterances.sentences: But he repeatedly dodged questions about whether he would sign a federal abortion ban.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I'm looking at a solution that is going to work, a very complex issue for the country. You have people on both sides of an issue.

utterances.speaker: ZELENY
utterances.sentences: On foreign policy, Trump once again showed his affinity for Russian President Vladimir Putin, declining to call for his punishment for leading the invasion of Ukraine.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: If you say he's a war criminal, it's got to be a lot tougher to make a deal to get this thing stopped.

utterances.speaker: ZELENY
utterances.sentences: He also declined to say who he wants to prevail in the war, despite the U.S. and allies investing billions to help Ukraine defeat Russia.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Do you want Ukraine to win this war?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I don't think in terms of winning and losing. I think in terms of getting it settled so we stop killing all these people.(END VIDEOTAPE) ZELENY (on camera):  Shortly after this town hall, President Biden tweeted, do you want four more years of that? Of course, it is many months until we know if there will be a rematch. Trump still faces a Republican primary. But on that front, he barely mentioned GOP rival at all, making only a passing and mocking reference to Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, who's planning to jump in this race soon. But with so much to digest, here's one more. When Kaitlan asked Trump if he would accept the results of the 2024 election, he declined to say he would. Poppy and Phil?

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Jeff Zeleny, great reporting, thanks so much.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Let's talk about all of this, what happened last night, CNN Political Analyst and Senior Political Correspondent at The New York Times Maggie Haberman is at the table, also CNN Political Commentators David Urban, he's a former Trump campaign adviser, and Van Jones, the former special adviser to President Obama.Good morning. I know no one got much sleep. Thanks for getting up. We didn't put you in the 6:00 A.M. hour, so that means we love you.

utterances.speaker: VAN JONES, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: We appreciate it, very, very kind.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: It's true.

utterances.speaker: MAGGIE HABERMAN, CNN POLITICAL ANALYST
utterances.sentences: It is true.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You know that.

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: I know from years, yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You know that. Maggie, you and Kaitlan, I think, are the journalists that know President Trump like the back of your hand, more than anyone else. What did last night tell you about the year-and-a- half ahead for the country?

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: All I kept thinking last night was that famous like Dennis Green football coach press conference, where he kept saying, they are who we thought they were. He is who we thought he is. It's never going to change.But you made a really important point here. If you take a step back, you're talking to Democrats, whatever their views on social media, there was a lot of Democrats saying this is gold for us, right? There's a text from a Biden adviser weeks' worth of damning content, it was quite an efficient hour. Can you -- can both be true, where the former president's advisers are thrilled, Republican primary voters are thrilled, and if you're a Democrat, you're watching that and saying we have got 50 attack ads based on one hour.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, I think if you're a Democrat watching that, we've been criticizing and complaining about Biden? This is a horror show that we don't want a rerun of, and I think a lot of Democrats were appalled by his behavior, him throwing Ukraine under the bus. I hope he gets sued again this morning for libel and slandering everything else. It's horrible toward the people who have been on their side of these legal cases.But, you know, I think that we've got to be careful here now because Trump has a particular trick that he uses with nostalgia. The whole make America great again is about -- there was this era that was wonderful, as 1950s, and I'm going to bring you back there. He's now using nostalgia about the Trump administration just a few years ago, everything was perfect. So, he's trying to own both the nostalgic past and a future he can bring you to, which leads Biden -- which started with the president and no place to go. And so if you're a Democrat, don't get just thrown off by the motions here. He's got a rhetorical strategy. We've got to figure out a way to take that narrative away from him. The Trump years were not perfect. By far, they were not perfect, even before COVID. So, you begin to see how you can have to fight this guy in a general, but I think this guy is almost unstoppable for the nomination.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Do you believe, David, as a former adviser to the president, President Trump, that this was gold for Democrats, for President Biden and in general? Let's just get to the general.

utterances.speaker: DAVID URBAN, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, I would say think it depends on where you're coming from. I think that Trump -- something Abby said last night, that's Trump being Trump, that's what you saw. Phil, you alluded to the same thing. I think it was a missed opportunity for the president in terms of what Van is saying is correct. Biden says this correctly all the time. Don't judge me against the almighty. Judge me against the alternative. And to Van's point, voters are going to look at Trump and they're going to look at the alternative, Biden. If you look at the numbers right now, and the current president's numbers suck. They're terrible.And so what explains Trump's strength? It's Biden's weakness, right? And so I think voters are going to make -- they're going to make that comparison. And I think last night was a missed opportunity for the president -- for them former president to say, look, Kaitlan, we're never going to agree on January 20th -- I mean, on the 2020 election, we're not going to agree on January 6th, but let's talk about some things we might agree on. We need a stronger border. We need to stop fentanyl. I mean, everyone today in America is watching the border crisis happen in real-time, and they're thinking we need to fix this. This isn't working correctly, right? And so Trump really missed an opportunity to really address those types of things. Inflation, Silicon Valley Bank, First Republic, all these things cratered because of inflationary policies of this administration.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And more management.

utterances.speaker: URBAN
utterances.sentences: No, I get it. But he could have framed those issues, right, but he missed it.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: He never misses an opportunity to miss an opportunity to talk about somebody who is not Trump.

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: Right. But that was what it was. He was so interested in defending himself and talking about himself, but he didn't talk about Biden at all.

utterances.speaker: URBAN
utterances.sentences: He just could have put pin in it, quick pivot and it would have been --

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: Then that would be him being a different person than he is too.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: In no world is that ever going to happen.

utterances.speaker: URBAN
utterances.sentences: This is my hopeful world.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Right. But that's the hopeful world that Republicans have been living in for the last seven years. And now, once again, they're after a day where he's on center stage and they're all running away from cameras and reporters who want to ask him about what the former president said.

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: Do the second day in a row for the jury verdict.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Right, exactly. But my I think my question to Maggie is what is the endgame here for him re-litigating all of this stuff besides the fact that he just is who he is?

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: I mean, I think that that is the End Game. I mean, I think it's two things. Advisers know that when he may try to prep him or try to control him or manage him, he tends to go even more in the opposite direction.

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: Right. I mean, some of his advisers were actually really happy with his January 6th answers. I couldn't quite get a clear sense as to --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: Right, that would be the question. On the pardoning issue in particular, it is because he didn't commit to, yes, they're all pardoned. It was likely -- MATTINGLY

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Equivocal on pardoning traitors.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Will you pardon the January 6th rioters who were convicted of federal offenses?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I am inclined to pardon many of them, I can't say for every single one because a couple of them probably they got out of control.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: I thought that was cool because he caveated it.

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes, it was better than the alternative, which is how this always tends to get looked at. I think to the point that you were making before, though, again, this was a forum where Kaitlan got a lot of news made, a lot, a lot of things that we have not heard him talk about, a lot of issues that he has not push because when people are traveling aboard the plane or he's going to a rally, it's something very different. And so how it plays for the team and they're feeling good that they're getting cheers is very different than what it might play out.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I think the point that -- Kaitlan was like a matador against the biggest bull in American history. And I think she put a lot of knives in that are going to pay off later on in terms of getting him to say stuff that actually he didn't actually said on the record before. I think that was very important.

utterances.speaker: URBAN
utterances.sentences: Yes. But to Maggie's point, Republicans got what they needed out of this. Trump got what he needed out of this. He's tough. People like the base likes to see that. He's in there mixing it up with the media again, not a friendly environment, right, for Donald Trump to come back to CNN. I kind of joke that you would never see Joe Biden wading into a Fox News debate.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I don't think that's fair comparison.

utterances.speaker: URBAN
utterances.sentences: No. CNN is not -- my point is --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So, let's not make it.

utterances.speaker: URBAN
utterances.sentences: -- an unfriendly.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Well, that was a friendly argument but --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I think you can't get a more objective journalist and interviewer than Kaitlan Collins.

utterances.speaker: URBAN
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not saying that. I'm just saying that -- I completely agree. Kaitlan did a great job. I'm just saying that Biden is not going to take -- he's not going to stand up to do that. I would love to see him take questions.

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: But with whom? Sean Hannity? I mean, like --

utterances.speaker: URBAN
utterances.sentences: I'd love to see him take questions from an audience like that, unscripted, no notes. It's tougher to deal with. We'll see if he does it. And I think the audience, by the way, whoever just said, they asked some pretty softball questions. There were no really pressing hard questions that they asked.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Final thought, Van?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I think that you can look at this from a political point of view, and we should. But from the point of view from the United States of a country, the idea that you got somebody who just basically put you on notice, you vote for me, I am going to help Putin. To me, that's -- the bigger take away is all the other stuff. What really matters in the world stage is what is going on in Ukraine. The fact he wouldn't say, I want Ukraine to win, I don't want dictators to win. I want to make sure Zelenskyy is triumphant here. The fact that he was equivocal and he both-sided a brutal dictator killing civilians and stealing children, we should not let that go unmarked (ph).

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Think about what Kevin McCarthy said a few weeks ago in Israel talking -- making that so clear, Maggie.

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: No. I think that's exactly right. I mean, listen, I think that there was a lot of insight that we got into where Trump is because we don't hear from him the way he used to. He's not on Twitter. People don't read Truth Social the way no matter what he says, they just don't, and so they what he did when he was on Twitter, he does not do a ton of mainstream interviews, and that's for a reason. There has also been fewer opportunities for him. He is the frontrunner for the Republican nomination by a very wide mile, so I don't see how you don't try to talk to him.I do think Dave is right, that the comparison of you're going to hear Republicans say Trump winning to, you know, an environment that Trump at least has argued isn't, you know, favorable to him and that he went back and forth. And I think that you're going to see them make that kind of comparison against Biden over and over, and that is going to basically be the frame they want this election to be, which is weak versus strong. I'm not saying that's the case but that's what they're going to push.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: URBAN
utterances.sentences: I must be right. Maggie agreed with me.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I know.

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: We can all go home now.

utterances.speaker: URBAN
utterances.sentences: All the news is free from --

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: We've solved all the problems. This is the solution, this table right here. Great job, everyone. Thanks, guys. I appreciate it. Well, the crowd at last night's town hall, they didn't hold back. CNN spoke to several of the audience members and got they reaction to what they heard from the former president.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Former President Trump made his case to voters across the nation during CNN's town hall hosted by our very own Kaitlan Collins in New Hampshire last night, but was he able to sway some undecided voters or did he convince fellow Republicans that they should give him another four years in the White House?Here is CNN's Gary Tuchman.

utterances.speaker: GARY TUCHMAN, CNN NATIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Poppy and Phil, we talked to eight people who were inside the town hall. Six of them have voted for Donald Trump before. One hasn't voted in the last two presidential elections but she is leaning Republican in 2024. Another one of the people is 18-year-old and will be voting in his first election in 2024 and is leaning Republican. A consensus, Trump should focus on 2024 and not 2020.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Personally, I'm getting tired of hearing about it. I'm very much more so interested in the problems that we face now.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I don't think anybody wants to hear about 2020 at this point. Everybody wants to hear about 2024, the future and what comes after that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I'd like him to move on. I would like him to stop talking about it, but it's his opinion.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It's uncomfortable. It's definitely uncomfortable. And I just don't know -- what to think anymore.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I didn't really care.

utterances.speaker: TUCHMAN
utterances.sentences: Why didn't you care? UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE

utterances.speaker: TUCHMAN
utterances.sentences: The final question, any of you ready to say you are ready to vote for Donald Trump on 2024? You are, one person? The rest not ready to say that yet? Thank you all for joining us.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: TUCHMAN
utterances.sentences: All eight people told us they did not feel better about Trump after this town hall, but they also didn't feel worse. What they heard, they expected to hear. Poppy, Phil?

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Gary Tuchman, thanks so much for that.And joining us now is Republican Congressman Brian Mast of Florida. He's the chair of the Veterans Coalition for Trump Campaigns, he's also a member of the House Foreign Affairs Committee. Congressman, thanks so much for joining us. I'm sure you watched last night. I think the voters that Gary was just talking to had an interesting perspective of, you hear from a lot of Republicans, a lot of your colleagues, you just want him to look forward, not back, look forward, not back. He must look back. It seems to be something he has to do. Do you wish he would look forward instead of looking back? REP. BRIAN MAST (R-FL):  I think the president wants to look forward. He's continually asked to look back. That's what I heard other people talk about this as well in the recap of the debate. He was asked for 30-something minutes about the past, about the past, about the past. There was definitely a two-way street.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: So, the reason why he was asked about the past is because she attempted to drive the overturning of the U.S. election, attempted to subvert the Constitution, and to some degree, because of a rally or in part due to a rally, his supporters, many of which have been prosecuted, stormed the U.S. Capitol that you were in. So, do you understand why maybe there would be some need to look back given he's the likely Republican nominee at this point?

utterances.speaker: MAST
utterances.sentences: Well, you're asking the question, does he need to look back or should he move forward? You can't have that both ways. But if you really want to rehash the issue, you're talking about a situation where the full weight and force of the federal government was exercised to subvert an election. Whether it was with social media companies, like Twitter and others, to go out there and get people that were former military generals to go out there and sign letters to say, oh, this is Russian disinformation, the list goes on and on.Those are important things that I don't think the president wants to sit there and talk about. But, again, Kaitlan asked him about for 30 minutes, so he's not going to run away from it, and that's why he's my choice for president. He's the guy takes the bull by the horns. He doesn't back down. He doesn't back down from a debate that he knows he is not going to be the most friendly environment. He goes in there saying, yes, I'll come in there and answer your questions. I'm not going to read the script. I'm going to give you the authentic me. This is what I actually think. This is how I actually feel. That is different. That's why Americans love him, for that strength.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: No, I understand, that's why his base is very fond of him, and obviously that he has a lot of support, more endorsements I think at this stage than he certainly did back in 2015. But --

utterances.speaker: MAST
utterances.sentences: Not just his base is fond of him but our enemies fear him, because you have somebody that does not back down from anyone or anything or any situation. That's the guy that I want dealing with Mexico. That's the guy I want dealing with China. That's the guy I want dealing with Ukraine.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Congressman, if U.S. adversaries fear him, do you consider Russia a U.S. adversary?

utterances.speaker: MAST
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: You are a very, very up front supporter of Ukraine. You have criticized the Biden administration for not having a strategy. You have criticized for not going far enough in terms of the weapons capability they're willing to deliver and as well as considering a no- fly zone, or been willing to consider a no-fly zone. The president last night said this when he was asked if he wanted Ukraine to win. Take a listen.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Can you say if you want Ukraine or Russia to win this war?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I want everybody to stop dying. They're dying, Russians and Ukrainians. I want them to stop dying. I'll have that done in 24 hours. I'll have it done. You need the power of the presidency to do it.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: But you won't say that you want Ukraine to win?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: You know what I'll say? I'll say this. I want Europe to put up more money.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: I mean, if you believe that that's -- what is the strength there?
